div.p: 20. VI. symbols 1 symbols 10 symbols Sun rose 6:52:50 = Faht. 13.

list.item: Bell—
Buchanan
Tomlinson
Cobb
Haynes

div.p: had a Letter from Dr. Aspen Surveyor Eastport— complains he has made enemies by suppressing Smugglers— Nomination of Breese, District Attorney, Illinois— Kane and Thomas.
The Call for Commission and Credentials of J. Sergeant, and for Panama Documents— Sanford wishes to comply with it.
Buchanan— spoke of P. S. Markley— does not believe the charges circulated against him— Considers him a very popular man &c
Tomlinson— Recommendations of Connor Surveyor at Hartford.

Report of Committee of Commerce, on the British Colonial trade— Moderate— Mix’s papers and charge against Calhoun. Surveyor of Hudson— no authority to appoint— Appropriation to furnish the President’s House— No authority to direct.

Cobb and Haynes— came by direction from Governor of Georgia— urge the removal of the Cherokees; and the exclusion of all the missionaries and Agents except Montgomery— Payment of Expenses for late Militia Movements by order of the Government of Georgia.
21. VI.30.— Round house Square 30 symbols. Sun rose 6:51:50 = 7:10. behind N. Corner of Theatre— Fahrenheit 10.

list.item: Heard. Walker— Acts 14:17.— and Numbers 24:13 symbols

Coleman. Quaker wishes order for discharge of W. Goit, David Goit . . .

Barbour— Appointments of Indian Agents and Brevet Officers.—
Clay. H— Instructions to Raguet and Appleton— Clark’s Memorial
Southard S. L. List of Marine Corps.
Biddle— Nicolas— Loan of 16. Millions. Bank U.S— would take it all
Pearce— D. J. Recommends Fogg in Tennessee— Kane’s dissatisfaction— Wheaton

list.head: Visitors from Mississippi
Visitors— Senators from Delaware, newly elected
Robertson, Collector
list.item: Robertson.
Bartley— Papers relating to the Land-Office at Tiffin
Forrest. R— Returned him the blank Exequatur for Commercial Agent.
O’Brien— Dr. Ayer— Surveyor at Eastport Charges agt. him
Ogden Coll. Letter from La Fayette, to Secy of War, for Dr. Condict.

list.head: Cabinet Meeting.
list.item: Southard
Bailey—

div.p: The Creek Indians have arrested the Surveyors from Georgia— Governor Troup has ordered out a Troop of Horse, to protect the Surveyors and force the Survey— Question discussed; what is to be done— Act of Congress of 30. March 1802— consulted— Section 5. forbids surveying— Section 16— Authorises the Military force of U—S— to apprehend any person trespassing on the Indian Lands, and convey him to the civil authority in one of the 3 next adjoining districts— Section 17— authorises the seizure and trial of trespassers found within any judicial district of U—S— It was proposed to order troops to the Spot— to apprehend the Surveyors, and bring them in for trial by authority of Section 16— I have no doubt of the right, but much of the expediency of so doing— Mr Clay urged the necessity of protecting the rights of the Indians by force— Their rights must be protected; but I think the civil process will be adequate to the purpose— The Georgia Surveyors act by authority and order of the State— To send troops against them must end in acts of violence— The Act of 1802 was not made for the case; and before coming to a conflict of arms, I should choose to refer the whole subject to Congress— Governor Barbour, proposed sending a confidential agent to warn the Georgians against proceeding— And the Cabinet Meeting was adjourned to Monday 1. P.M—
Bailey spent the Evening with me.
28. VI:30. Cloud— Fog— Thaw.

list.item: Heard Hill at Little’s— John 3.2.
Dwight— H— W— came home with me— Navy Estimates— L. M’Lane
Heard Stow at Baker’s. Proverbs 1–7.
Evening symbols

div.p: 29. VII symbols. Cloudy

list.head: Simms applies for the appointment of Secretary to the Territory of Florida, vacated by the resignation of G. Walton— Mr Southard also recommends Symmes.
list.item: Symmes.

list.head: Came to enquire the state of the question with G. Britain relating to the boundary at Rouse’s point and on Lake Champlain
list.item: Ross.
Fitzgerald, for Patterson— Tailor’s Bill agt.W. Lee— Also for a place
Allen. W. H. Says Jos. M. White is an adversary to the Administration

list.head: With three enrolled Bills for signature.

list.item: Barbour. Letter from Crowell Agent to the Creek Indians.
Graham— with partial Report on a Resn. of Senate of 16. May

list.head: Cabinet Meeting— Barbour’s answer to Crowell, and Letter to Governor Troup— Modifications suggested— To avoid all irritating expressions— Proclamation not necessary— Message to be prepared for Congress
list.item: Clay—
Rush.
Barbour
Southard
White. Joseph. M— Recommends Overton, for Florida Secretary— Denmark—
Starr— from Halifax—a young man introduced by Thomas L. M’Kenney—

div.p: Sent two Messages to S.U.S— One with papers relating to Panama Mission
One— Answer to Resn. of 4. April 1826— On Lands unfit for cultivation—

White wishes to be appointed Charge d’Affaires to Denmark— Mrs White very unwilling to go back to Florida— He has no doubt of his own re-election; but must fight his way there— Barely escaped a duel the last time he was there— Southard had an insolent Letter from a Lieutenant Legaré at Pensacola, under suspension, and charges of intemperance—and misconduct; for trial— He tenders his resignation, and talks of oppression, abuses and corruption— I advised not to accept his resignation; but to make a new charge against him for writing the Letter— I agreed to send a list of nominations for Brevets in the army for ten years service in one grade—
30. VI: Rain. symbols

list.item: Lyman— Theodore— Visit—

Biddle— Evening visit— Mr Monroe relieved from Embarrassment.
